email_chain.subject: Freight Quote for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I hope this email finds you well. I’m reaching out regarding your inquiry for a crude oil shipment from Houston to Rotterdam. We have a suitable vessel, the MV Ocean Star, with a DWT of 150,000 and an LOA of 280m. The starting freight quote is in the low 50s, say $50.75 per metric ton. Laycan is 15-20 October. Let me know your thoughts. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the quick response. The vessel details look good, but the freight rate is a bit on the higher side. Given the current market, could you consider something in the high 40s? Also, can we confirm the laytime and demurrage terms? Best, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, thanks for your feedback. I understand your concern about the rate. After discussing with the owner, we can offer $49.50 per metric ton. Laytime is 72 hours total, and demurrage is set at $20,000 per day pro rata. Let me know if this works for you. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, $49.50 sounds reasonable. However, could we push the laycan to 18-23 October? Also, can we cap the demurrage at $18,000 per day? Looking forward to your confirmation. Best, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I’ve confirmed with the owner. We can adjust the laycan to 18-23 October and cap demurrage at $18,000 per day. If this works, I’ll draft the charter party agreement. Let me know. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, that works for us. Please proceed with drafting the agreement. Thanks for your flexibility. Best, John
